text.__SUMMARY__: Quercus mespilifolia is the accepted name of a tree species in the Asian sub-genus of 'ring-cupped oaks' and the family Fagaceae; there are no known subspecies.The known distribution of Q. mespilifolia is Burma, Thailand, Laos and Vietnam: where it can be found in the Sơn La and Lang Bian areas and may be called sồi lá nhôt.
